paragraphs.text: So far, I have not seen a single article in the members only emails that I have had any interest in reading. It is all the stuff I avoid on Medium: tech, self-help, SJW politics, etc. A good example would be Creating Usability with Motion: The UX in Motion Manifesto. Fascinating stuff, for someone.
paragraphs.name: 24e3

5f2b52d3bb4d.title: I believe I’ll be giving up my halo soon. :)

paragraphs.text: I believe I’ll be giving up my halo soon. :)
paragraphs.name: b773

paragraphs.text:
Morning, Mike.
If you’re not enjoying your home page, I don’t see how you could find value in membership at all. I’m paying for this front page and I wouldn’t want to miss it anymore. Medium could hike the price and I would pay that too. — yeah I’m a sucker lol.
paragraphs.name: da6c

content.subtitle: But, Just to clear a small thing up: “Lit” is not “paywall” it’s just a header you can have on your homepage, or not.

virtuals.subtitle: But, Just to clear a small thing up: “Lit” is not “paywall” it’s just a header you can have on your homepage, or not.

3cd54fcd08d5.title: I got old too soon. And I don’t eat anything that isn’t dead and cooked. :)

paragraphs.text: I got old too soon. And I don’t eat anything that isn’t dead and cooked. :)
paragraphs.name: c773

paragraphs.text: Suggestions for Medium’s membership program
paragraphs.name: 2e82

paragraphs.text: I think Mike brought up great points about Medium’s current status quo with the membership program.
paragraphs.name: 305e

paragraphs.text: I personally didn’t join the membership for several reasons and none of them have to do with the fact that I have to pay for it…
paragraphs.name: f290

content.subtitle: I think Mike brought up great points about Medium’s current status quo with the membership program.

virtuals.subtitle: I think Mike brought up great points about Medium’s current status quo with the membership program.

9ff851c0e9a4.title: no downsides at all — i held back and still do xx

paragraphs.text: no downsides at all — i held back and still do xx

d3dcf8eef761.title: Those are precisely the three categories I avoid (although some of the tech stuff is interesting).

paragraphs.text: Those are precisely the three categories I avoid (although some of the tech stuff is interesting).
paragraphs.name: eabb

689eb5c65c83.title: Perhaps I’m not using the new homepage correctly. Thanks for clarifying the Lit situation.

paragraphs.text: Perhaps I’m not using the new homepage correctly. Thanks for clarifying the Lit situation.
paragraphs.name: d189

paragraphs.text: I hope you do stay. You perform the function of offering a dissenting voice and doing it well. There aren’t many others doing that. SJW group think is rampant on Medium. Last year I was banished for challenging that. Thinks are actually a little less quarrelsome now than then.
paragraphs.name: 00d8

content.subtitle: But mostly because you are an excellent writer, capable of present a logical, sustained argument. The mostly Millenials one encounters here…

virtuals.subtitle: But mostly because you are an excellent writer, capable of present a logical, sustained argument. The mostly Millenials one encounters here…

e011f26e917.title: Mike, thank you for finally answering the question I’ve always had as a fiction writer and poet.

paragraphs.text: Mike, thank you for finally answering the question I’ve always had as a fiction writer and poet. Everyone else seems to be in some other frame of mind that because they’re paying for it, the membership is worth it. I’m glad you’ve found it isn’t. It’s made me decide not to go forward with it.
paragraphs.name: 4dbe

19115bfa091.title: I think the point is “these go to eleven”. ;-)

paragraphs.text: I think the point is “these go to eleven”. ;-)
Good points. I have my criticisms (like the puny text editor), but I still find Medium valuable. Just not five bucks a month worth.
paragraphs.name: d65d

1c9429cec41.title: Did you quit your day job too soon?

paragraphs.text: Did you quit your day job too soon?
paragraphs.name: 301e

paragraphs.text: Anyway, if 5 bucks isn’t working for ya…you should return to free and use the 5 bucks for a dish of sushi.
paragraphs.name: ea07

virtuals.subtitle: I was one of the first to respond to this, although Renée S and Aura Wilming then did much better jobs of it than I did. That was a month…

53818e14bfe8.title: It was Medium that inspired me to put the Paypal button on my posts.

paragraphs.text: It was Medium that inspired me to put the Paypal button on my posts. I figure if they can ask $5 a month for nothing, I can ask for voluntary contributions for something. If it doesn’t work out, I lose nothing, nor do my readers.
paragraphs.name: c1f8

f7f6e50003df.title: This may well be because there is not much further down that it could go.

paragraphs.text: I have read no complaints from non-members saying that their user experience has been degraded.
paragraphs.name: 9c69

paragraphs.text: This may well be because there is not much further down that it could go. The text-editing is mediocre at best, the audience access and networking capabilities are — wait, do these exist at all? The actions of blocking and of…
paragraphs.name: 88e6

content.subtitle: The obvious world view being aggressively propagated by Medium, is that the President of the United States is by default a fascist monster…

virtuals.subtitle: The obvious world view being aggressively propagated by Medium, is that the President of the United States is by default a fascist monster…

1469b3e45f80.title: Yeah Mike, I’m thinking of pulling out of membership after a month of very little, if anything…

paragraphs.text: Yeah Mike, I’m thinking of pulling out of membership after a month of very little, if anything worth it. My $5 was hopefully to go towards writers I enjoy and want to support, but now I’m just hoping more will put a paypal up like you, and I’ll just send my money directly to them instead. Keep an eye out for it. I’m debating one more month, but not too heavily.
paragraphs.name: e55e

ad2158eab59665d686a741b551eaeef0.title: Yeah Mike, I’m thinking of pulling out of membership after a month of very little, if anything…
